Truths (limit=None):
[
    "The SynapseBand is a wearable, non-invasive neural headband.",
    "The SynapseBand detects and decodes neural activity in real time.",
    "The SynapseBand uses a 128-channel dry EEG sensor array with adaptive calibration.",
    "The SynapseBand has a brain-to-command response time of less than 15 milliseconds.",
    "The SynapseBand uses deep-learning–based AI to decode motor, cognitive, and emotional states.",
    "The SynapseBand has a battery life of 22 hours of continuous operation.",
    "The SynapseBand supports secure 5G, Wi-Fi 6, and BLE connectivity.",
    "The SynapseBand is compatible with iOS, Android, Windows, and VR/AR ecosystems.",
    "NeuroLink’s Cognitive Signal Processing Framework (CSPF) integrates hybrid EEG-fNIRS sensing, advanced artifact removal, and self-learning AI interpreters.",
    "The CSPF enables precise brain activity monitoring without invasive implants.",
    "The CSPF improves accuracy continuously via federated learning.",
    "All SynapseBand sessions sync to NeuroCloud, a HIPAA-compliant cloud environment.",
    "Clinicians can track patient progress over time using NeuroCloud.",
    "Developers can build BCI-enabled apps through open APIs provided by NeuroCloud.",
    "Patients can manage mental health, focus, and rehabilitation exercises with real-time dashboards on NeuroCloud.",
    "NeuroCloud supports integration with EHR systems and platforms like Oculus, Microsoft Mesh, and Apple Vision Pro via HL7 and FHIR."
] 
 
Claims:
[
    "Data from Neuralink devices is transmitted through secure 5G, Wi-Fi 6, and BLE integration."
]

        "verdict": "no",
        "reason": "The retrieval context states that the SynapseBand, not Neuralink devices, transmits data through secure 5G, Wi-Fi 6, and BLE integration. The claim incorrectly attributes this feature to Neuralink devices."
    }
]
